intro: Veronica hyssopifolia, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Veronica hyssopifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
